org.sat4j.tools.encoding

Class Commander

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sat4j.tools.encoding.EncodingStrategyAdapter
      • org.sat4j.tools.encoding.Commander
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class Commander
extends EncodingStrategyAdapter
    Commander encoding for "at most one" and "at most k" cases. The case "at most one" is introduced in W. Klieber and G. Kwon "Efficient CNF encoding for selecting 1 from N objects" in Fourth Workshop on Constraints in Formal Verification, 2007. The generalization to the "at most k" case is described in A. M. Frisch and P . A. Giannaros, "SAT Encodings of the At-Most-k Constraint", in International Workshop on Modelling and Reformulating Constraint Satisfaction Problems, 2010
    Since:
    2.3.1
    Author:
    sroussel
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • addAtMostOne

        public IConstr addAtMostOne(ISolver solver,
                            IVecInt literals)
                     throws ContradictionException
        In this encoding, variables are partitioned in groups. Kwon and Klieber claim that the fewest clauses are produced when the size of the groups is 3, thus leading to 3.5 clauses and introducing n/2 variables.
        Overrides:
        addAtMostOne in class EncodingStrategyAdapter
        Throws:
        ContradictionException
